{{cpp/title|setw}}
{{cpp/io/manip/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=iomanip|
/* unspecified */ setw( int n );
}}

When used in an expression {{c|out &lt;&lt; std::setw(n)}} or {{c|in &gt;&gt; std::setw(n)}}, sets the {{tt|width}} parameter of the stream {{c|out}} or {{c|in}} to exactly {{c|n}}.

Some operations reset the width to zero (see [[#Notes|below]]), so {{tt|std::setw}} may need to be repeatedly called to set the width for multiple operations.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|n|new value for width}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{cpp/io/manip/iomanip return value|setw}}

===Notes===
The width property of the stream will be reset to zero (meaning "unspecified") if any of the following functions are called:
* Input
:* {{ltf|cpp/string/basic_string/operator ltltgtgt|operator&gt;&gt;|args=basic_istream&amp;, basic_string&amp;}}
:* {{ltf|cpp/io/basic_istream/operator gtgt2|operator&gt;&gt;|args=basic_istream&amp;, char*}}
* Output
:* Overloads of {{ltf|cpp/io/basic_ostream/operator ltlt|basic_ostream::operator&lt;&lt;}} that take arithmetic types or {{c/core|void}} pointers (at Stage 3 of {{l2tf|cpp/locale/num_put/put}})
:* {{ltf|cpp/io/basic_ostream/operator ltlt2|operator&lt;&lt;|args=basic_ostream&amp;, char}} and {{ltf|cpp/io/basic_ostream/operator ltlt2|operator&lt;&lt;|args=basic_ostream&amp;, char*}}
:* {{ltf|cpp/string/basic_string/operator ltltgtgt|operator&lt;&lt;|args=basic_ostream&amp;, basic_string&amp;}}
:* {{lc|std::put_money}} (inside {{l2tf|cpp/locale/money_put/put}})
:* {{lc|std::quoted}} (when used with an output stream)

The exact effects this modifier has on the input and output vary between the individual I/O functions and are described at each {{c/core|operator&lt;&lt;}} and {{c/core|operator&gt;&gt;}} overload page individually.

===Example===
{{example
|
|code=
#include &lt;iomanip&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;sstream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "no setw: [" &lt;&lt; 42 &lt;&lt; "]\n"
              &lt;&lt; "setw(6): [" &lt;&lt; std::setw(6) &lt;&lt; 42 &lt;&lt; "]\n"
              &lt;&lt; "no setw, several elements: [" &lt;&lt; 89 &lt;&lt; 12 &lt;&lt; 34 &lt;&lt; "]\n"
              &lt;&lt; "setw(6), several elements: [" &lt;&lt; 89 &lt;&lt; std::setw(6) &lt;&lt; 12 &lt;&lt; 34 &lt;&lt; "]\n";
    
    std::istringstream is("hello, world");
    char arr[10];
    
    is &gt;&gt; std::setw(6) &gt;&gt; arr;
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Input from \"" &lt;&lt; is.str() &lt;&lt; "\" with setw(6) gave \""
              &lt;&lt; arr &lt;&lt; "\"\n";
}
|output=
no setw: [42]
setw(6): [    42]
no setw, several elements: [891234]
setw(6), several elements: [89    1234]
Input from "hello, world" with setw(6) gave "hello"
}}
